methods.name: module:sap/ui/fl/write/api/ChangesWriteAPI.restoreDeletedFlexObjects
methods.description: Restores previously deleted FlexObjects. Objects are restored to the state they were in before deletion. If the flex object was not persisted, it is added as a dirty object again. Once the deletion is persisted, changes will not be restored.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/fl/write/api/ChangesWriteAPI.revert

returnValue.description: Promise or fake promise resolving to the control on which a change was reverted successully, or false when unsuccessful, or an array with the return value of the revert call for each given change

parameters.name: change
parameters.description: Change object that should be reverted from the passed element, or an array of changes

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: Element instance on which the change should be reverted

methods.description: Reverts a change or an array of changes on the passed control if the changes have already been applied or are in the process of being applied. Make sure to provide the changes in the order that they were applied - this method executes the reversal in the reverse order.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl
symbols.description: This is the library for SAPUI5 flexibility. It includes the handling of changes made on applications, such as descriptor changes, app variants, UI changes, control variants (a.k.a. views), and personalization, as well as APIs for consumers. In addition, it provides the sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement control, which enables applications to use control variants (views).

Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addLibraries. Loops over one change which might contain several libraries. If one library already exists, merge it, else add new library to manifest.

Available for both runtime and build sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.Registration.

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with merged dependencies

parameters.name: libraries
parameters.description: Change content containing libraries names and minVersion

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_addLibraries change to the manifest.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddLibrary

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModel
symbols.description:
Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addNewModel. Adds a new model to the manifest.json under path sap.ui5.models. It can also make changes to the path sap.app.dataSources. It supports different types of models (for example: ResourceModel and OData).

Available only for build sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModel.applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with merged content

methods.description: Method to apply the appdescr_ui5_addNewModel change to the manifest.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModel

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModelEnhanceWith
symbols.description:
Descriptor change merger for change type appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith. Adds a settings/enhanceWith node of an existing model with a path to an i18n properties file relative to the location of the manifest. Only works for referenced models of type sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel.

Only available during build time sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.RegistrationBuild.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.changes.descriptor.ui5.AddNewModelEnhanceWith.applyChange

returnValue.description: Updated manifest with sap.ui5/models entity

parameters.description: ID of existing model, referenced model must have type sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel

constructor.description:
Flexibility change class. Stores change content and related information. This class also be updated as well as reverted.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addRevertInfo

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oRevertInfo
parameters.description: The revertInfo to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some revertInfo to the aggregation revertInfo.

methods.name: destroyRevertInfo

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the revertInfo in the aggregation revertInfo.

parameters.description: The revertInfo whose index is looked for

methods.name: insertRevertInfo

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oRevertInfo
parameters.description: The revertInfo to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the revertInfo should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the revertInfo is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the revertInfo is inserted at the last position

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation revertInfo.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

returnValue.description: The removed revertInfo or null

parameters.name: vRevertInfo
parameters.description: The revertInfo to remove or its index or id

symbols.description: Base class for data selectors

properties.name: cachedResult
properties.description: Temporary cache to store calculated values or, in case of parameterized selectors, key value pairs like parentSelectorParameterValue: { parameterValue: { someKey: someValue } }

properties.name: checkInvalidation
properties.description: Callback function to compare the current base data with the base data that was used to calculate the derived state Must return true if a recalculation is required

properties.name: executeFunction
properties.description: Callback function to build the derived state Must not return null or undefined to allow proper cache invalidation

properties.name: initFunction
properties.description: Callback function which is executed once for every parameter after the selector is created.

properties.name: parameterKey
properties.description: If no parameter key is set, the data selector cache is not parameterized

properties.name: parentDataSelector
properties.description: Parent selector for chaining DataSelectors. If a parent selector is provided, its execute function is called first with the parameters that were specified by the consumer The result is then passed to the execute function of the next selector as base data for further calculations See sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.flexState.DataSelector.

properties.name: updateListeners
properties.description: List of callback functions which are notified in case of state changes

constructor.description:
Base class for data selectors. The ID of the data selector should hint on the return type, i.e. plural for arrays and otherwise singular.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.flexState.FlexState
symbols.description:
Flex state class to persist maps and raw state (cache) for a given component reference. The persistence happens inside an object mapped to the component reference, with the following properties:

{ preparedMaps: { compVariantsMap: {}, }, storageResponse: { changes: { annotationChanges: [...], appDescriptorChanges: [...], changes: [...], comp: { variants: [...], changes: [...], defaultVariants: [...], standardVariants: [...] } variants: [...], variantChanges: [...], variantDependentControlChanges: [...], variantManagementChanges: [...], ui2personalization: {...} }, loadModules: }, unfilteredStorageResponse: {...}, // same as above but without layer filtering runtimePersistence: { flexObjects: [...], runtimeOnlyData: { liveDependencyMap: {...} } }, maxLayer: , emptyState: , partialFlexState: , componentId: "", componentData: {...} }
symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.flexState.FlexState

parameters.description: The callback will also be called after the initial variant is applied

methods.description: Saves a function that will be called after a variant has been applied with the new variant as parameter. Even if the same variant is selected again the callback is called. The function also performs a sanity check after the control has been rendered. If the passed variant control ID does not match the responsible variant management control, the callback will not be saved. Optionally this function is also called after the initial variant is applied without a sanity check.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.apply.api.ControlVariantApplyAPI.clearVariantParameterInURL

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Variant management control for which the URL technical parameter has to be cleared

methods.description: Clears URL technical parameter sap-ui-fl-control-variant-id for control variants. Use this method in case you normally want the variant parameter in the URL, but have a few special navigation patterns where you want to clear it. If you don't want that parameter in general, set the updateVariantInURL parameter on your variant management control to false. SAP Fiori elements use this method. If a variant management control is given as a parameter, only parameters specific to that control are cleared.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.PropertyInfo
symbols.description: Object containing metadata properties and nodes. Deep structure.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Technical name of the property, in case of nested properties (e.g. complex types in OData) it is the name of the property that has nested properties

properties.name: label
properties.description: If metadata has label information, it should be provided. A fallback to the technical name is implemented in the tooling and doesn't need to be provided by delegates

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: If metadata has tooltip information (e.g. quickinfo annotation in OData), it should be provided. A fallback to the label or technical name is implemented in the tooling and doesn't need to be provided by delegates

properties.name: bindingPath
properties.description: Relative binding path, starting from the current binding context. Usually the same as the name, but for nested properties (e.g. complex properties or navigation properties) it has segments

properties.name: unsupported
properties.description: The delegate has to return all properties that could be bound somewhere. However some properties maybe shouldn't appear in the dialog (e.g. properties you would name in the filter attribute of SmartForms or properties that are unsupported by the delegate's create methods). These properties should be marked as unsupported.

properties.name: hideFromReveal
properties.description: The delegate has to return all properties that could be bound somewhere. However some properties maybe shouldn't appear in the dialog (e.g. based on UI.Hidden annotation or Field Control). These properties should be marked as hiddenByAnnotation.

properties.name: entityType
properties.description: Only needed for OData-based delegates to help custom field support tooling

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Some properties can be nested (e.g. based on complex types and navigation properties in OData). In this case the delegate can provide these nested properties. However currently only nesting of one level is supported by adaptation dialogs.

symbols.title: typedef sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.PropertyInfo

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.RepresentedPropertyInfo
symbols.description: Object containing information about properties represented on the UI. The property may be hidden, but was placed by someone before, so you would like to reveal it instead of recreating it.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Control ID that represents this metadata property

properties.name: bindingPaths
properties.description: Binding path that represents this property, the binding path doesn't need to be used in a real binding.

symbols.title: typedef sap.ui.fl.interfaces.delegate.RepresentedPropertyInfo

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description:
Can be used to manage variants. You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for key user adaptation.
Note: On the user interface, variants are generally referred to as "views".

properties.name: displayTextForExecuteOnSelectionForStandardVariant
properties.description:
Defines the Apply Automatically text for the standard variant in the Manage Views dialog if the application controls this behavior.

Note: The usage of this property is restricted to sap.fe components only.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates whether the buttons on My Views are visible.

properties.name: executeOnSelectionForStandardDefault
properties.description: Determines the behavior for Apply Automatically if the standard variant is marked as the default variant.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.104.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates whether the control is in error state. If set to true, an error message will be displayed when the variant is opened.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description:
Sets the maximum width of the control.

Since: 1.109.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description: The name of the model containing the data.

properties.name: resetOnContextChange
properties.description:
If set to false, it does not reset the VariantManagement control to the default variant if its binding context is changed.

Note: The VariantManagement control itself is not affected by this property. It is only used internally by the SAPUI5 flexibility layer.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates whether the functionality of setting a default variant is enabled. The Default column in Manage Views and the Set as Default checkbox in Save View will be disabled if set to false.

properties.name: titleStyle
properties.description:
Defines the style of the title. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle.

Since: 1.109.

properties.name: updateVariantInURL
properties.description:
Indicates whether the current variant is updated based on the passed information in the URL.

Note: The VariantManagement control itself is not affected by this property. It is only used internally by the SAPUI5 flexibility layer.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the IDs of the relevant controls for which the variant management is used.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new VariantManagement.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: List of variant keys and the associated Execute on Selection indicator. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and an exe flag describing the intention.

parameters.name: fav
parameters.description: List of variant keys and the associated favorite indicator. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and a visible flag describing the intention.

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: List of variant keys and the associated contexts array. Each entry contains a key (the variant key) and a contexts array describing the contexts. Note: It is only used internally by the SAPUI5 flexibility layer.

events.description: This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Views dialog.

parameters.description: Indicates the checkbox state for Create Tile Note: This event parameter is used only internally.

Application developers can use this API to decide if the key user adaptation feature should be visible to the current user. App variant functionality should be available if the following conditions are met: When the current layer is 'CUSTOMER'. When it is not a standalone app. When the backend supports this feature.
